Vejpanje ni brez tveganj za srčno-žilni sistem
07 Nov 2019, 13:24 by STA

Kajenje elektronskih cigaret oz. vejpanje bi lahko negativno vplivalo na srčno-žilni sistem, kaže danes objavljena raziskava ameriških znanstvenikov. Kot poudarjajo, zaradi tega za zdaj ni mogoče govoriti, da je vejpanje varna alternativa kajenju navadnih cigaret.



Foto: Wikipedia

COLUMBUS > "Elektronske cigarete vsebujejo nikotin, fine delce, kovine in arome, ne gre le za paro neškodljive vode," je ob objavi študije poudaril njen glavni avtor, profesor Loren Wold z univerze v Ohiu.
Kot je dodal, raziskave onesnaženosti zraka kažejo, da fini delci, manjši od 2,5 mikrona, vdrejo v krvni obtok in vplivajo na srce. "In ugotovitve v zvezi z elektronskimi cigaretami gredo v to smer," je navedel.
Študija bo verjetno prilila olja na ogenj razpravam, ki se že nekaj časa vrtijo okoli vprašanja varnosti elektronskih cigaret. Zdravstvene službe, med njimi Svetovna zdravstvena organizacija, navajajo, da elektronskih cigaret ni mogoče obravnavati kot pripomočka za preprečevanje kajenja, ker je o njihovih vplivih na zdravje premalo znanega. Na drugi strani pa zagovorniki vejpanja trdijo, da za ljudi, ki so že kadili, obstaja znanstveno soglasje, da je vejpanje manj škodljivo kot kajenje. Pri elektronskih cigaretah je še vedno prisoten nikotin, ni pa rakotvornih snovi, ki jih kadilci vdihavajo pri kajenju navadnih cigaret, pravijo.
Študijo, ki vključuje predhodne raziskave v zvezi z elektronskimi cigaretami, so objavili v publikaciji združenja evropskih kardiologov Cardiovascular Research.
Eden njenih glavnih namenov je uživalce elektronskih cigaret povabiti k razmisleku, tiste, ki niso nikoli kadili, pa odvrniti tako od kajenja kot od vejpanja. "Gre za tveganje, ki ga preprosto ni vredno prevzeti," je po poročanju nemške tiskovne agencije dpa poudaril Wold.
Polemike okoli vejpanja je v zadnjih mesecih še zaostrila skrivnostna epidemija med vejperji v ZDA. Zaradi hudega obolenja pljuč je doslej umrlo 37 ljudi, okoli 1900 pa jih je zbolelo, kažejo podatki ameriškega Centra za nadzor in preprečevanje bolezni. Tretjina obolelih je uporabljala elektronske cigarete s proizvodi s psihoaktivno učinkovino kanabisa, THC, ki so jih pogosto kupili na črnem trgu. A vzroki epidemije za zdaj ostajajo neznanka.
Avtorji so v študiji izpostavili učinke nikotina, ki zvišuje krvni tlak in pospešuje bitje srca, ter finih delcev, ki lahko povzročijo poapnenje arterij in vnetje. "Ti učinki nakazujejo, da bi lahko dolgoročno kajenje elektronski cigaret povečalo tveganje za razvoj srčno-žilnih bolezni," so poudarili.
Ob tem so se zavzeli tudi za nadaljnje študije o aromah, ki jih vsebujejo tekočine za elektronske cigarete. Kot so navedli, jih sicer večina velja za varne, ko se jih užije, njihov učinki, ko se jih vdihava, pa so le malo znani.
Zapisali so tudi, da bi bilo treba opraviti raziskave o vplivih dolgoročne uporabe elektronskih cigaret, saj večina obstoječih študij preučuje vplive vejpanja v krajšem časovnem obdobju.

Vaping is not without risks to the cardiovascular system
07 Nov 2019, 12:24 by STA

Smoking electronic cigarettes. veeping could adversely affect the cardiovascular system, according to a study released today by US scientists. As they point out, for this reason it cannot be said that smoking is a safe alternative to smoking ordinary cigarettes.



Photo: Wikipedia

COLUMBUS> "Electronic cigarettes contain nicotine, fine particles, metals and flavorings, not just vapor in harmless water," said the study's lead author, Professor Loren Wold of the University of Ohio, at the publication of the study.
He added that air pollution studies show that fine particles smaller than 2.5 microns invade the bloodstream and affect the heart. "And the findings regarding e-cigarettes go in that direction," he stated.
The study is likely to spill oil on the debate that has been around for some time on the issue of electronic cigarette safety. Health services, including the World Health Organization, state that electronic cigarettes cannot be considered as a smoking cessation device because there is little known about their health effects. On the other hand, advocates of smoking have argued that for people who have already smoked, there is a scientific consensus that smoking is less harmful than smoking. Electronic cigarettes still contain nicotine, but there are no carcinogens that smokers inhale when smoking regular cigarettes, they say.
The study, which includes previous research on electronic cigarettes, was published in a publication by the Association of European Cardiologists, Cardiovascular Research.
One of its main purposes is to invite electronic cigarette users to think, and to discourage those who have never smoked from smoking and smoking. "This is a risk that is simply not worth taking," Wold said, according to German news agency dpa.
The controversy over vaping has been exacerbated in recent months by a mysterious epidemic of vipers in the US. Severe lung disease has left 37 people dead and about 1900 sick, according to data from the American Center for Disease Control and Prevention. A third of the patients used electronic cigarettes containing the psychoactive substance cannabis, THC, which they often bought on the black market. But the causes of the epidemic remain unknown for now.
The authors highlighted in the study the effects of nicotine, which raises blood pressure and speeds up the heartbeat, as well as the fine particles that can cause arterial distension and inflammation. "These effects suggest that long-term smoking of electronic cigarettes could increase the risk of developing cardiovascular disease," they emphasized.
They also called for further studies on the flavors contained in e-cigarette liquids. As they have stated, most are considered safe when consumed, and their effects when inhaled are little known.
They also noted that research on the effects of the long-term use of e-cigarettes should be conducted, as most existing studies examine the effects of smoking in a shorter period of time.
